title: WCAS FRENCH 211-0-20 Reading Cultures in French

Literature & Fine Arts Distro Area

Attendance at 1st class mandatory

Reading, writing, speaking proficiency

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: An introduction to French culture through study and analysis of major themes, issues and debates that characterize or preoccupy contemporary French thought and society, this course will help students understand French society and culture in today's world. Conducted entirely in French, this course is designed to increase students' ability to speak, read, and write in French, and improve their aural comprehension. Drawing on the notion of "la France en mutation / changing France," we will explore the challenges posed to the traditional republican notion of French national identity by immigration, feminism, gay activism, the integration into the European Union, and globalization through the study of a wide range of documents, texts, and films.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: French 202, AP score of 5, or consent of instructor.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Class discussion, oral reports, short lectures. Conducted entirely in French.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Active participation in class discussion (including participation on BB), response papers, 2 papers, final project (individual or group presentation).
